headline: Tinubu attributes Oyetola’s primary victory to remarkable performance
summarized_story:
A national leader of the All Progressives Congress, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu, has congratulated Osun State Governor, Adegboyega Oyetola, on his victory in the party’s governorship primary.
Tinubu, in a statement on Monday from his media office signed by Tunde Rahman, attributed Oyetola’s victory to his remarkable performance during his first term.
He said, “Last Saturday, February 19, 2022, the All Progressives Congress members in Osun State rose in their large numbers to exercise their democratic rights.
For this overwhelming victory in the APC primary election, I wholeheartedly congratulate and rejoice with Governor Oyetola.
“This electoral victory is not only for him (Oyetola), but also for the APC and the APC members in Osun.

headline: APC governors meet on consensus, zoning
summarized_story:
Governors elected on the platform of the All Progressives Congress on Monday evening met behind closed-door at the Kebbi Governors’ Lodge, Abuja.
The meeting came a few hours after the Mai Mala Buni-led Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee postponed the party’s national convention earlier slated for February 26 by another one month; the third time since December 2021.
Although the Progressives Governors’ Forum Chairman, Abubakar Bagudu, did not state the specific issues to be discussed at the meeting, it is believed that the meeting will discuss a consensus chairmanship candidate ahead of March 26.
The meeting was also meant to enable the governors to take common positions on issues like zoning ahead of Tuesday’s meeting with the President, Major General Muhammadu Buhari (retd.
As the time of filing this report, the meeting was still ongoing as governors of Katsina, Aminu Masari; Zamfara, Bello Matawalle; and Cross River, Ben Ayade were yet to arrive.

headline: 2023: Bolaji Abdullahi joins Kwara Central Senatorial District race
summarized_story:
Former Minister of Youths and Sports, Mallam Bolaji Abdullahi on Monday declared his interest to vie for Kwara Central senatorial election in 2023 on the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP).
Bolaji,a former National Spokesman of All Progressives Congress,(APC) and former Commissioner for Education and Human Capital Development in Kwara state made his intention known amidst pomp and pageantry at the State party secretariat in Ilorin.
He said,”No matter what may have happened in the past, 2023 provides us yet another opportunity to hit the reset button and rededicate ourselves to the great task of nation-building.
“He however noted that “Our dear country Nigeria is at the moment faced with numerous challenges, some of them unprecedented in nature and in scale.
He stressed among others that, “insecurity has its iron knees firmly planted on the throat of our nation.

headline: We’ve returned APC to Imo people, Uzodimma assures stakeholders
summarized_story:
Begs stakeholders to market APCThe Imo state governor, Hope Uzodimma, has pleaded with his members of the All Progressives Congress, APC, to market the party in the state.
The governor stated this through his Chief Press Secretary, CPS, Oguike Nwachukwu, on Monday in Owerri, at the APC, stakeholders meeting held at the party secretariat.
According to the governor’s CPS, “His Excellency, Distinguished Senator Hope Uzodimma has assured Stakeholders of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Imo State of returning the ruling party to the people.
“Governor Uzodimma used the opportunity to inform intending party members that the door of the APC in Imo State is open and that the Party is more united than it had ever been.
Speaking earlier, the Imo APC Chairman, Dr Ebere Macdonald, commended Governor Uzodimma for the massive support and unity that he inspires within the Party.

summarized_story:
A 39-year-old man, Mr Offiah Chiedozie, on Monday appeared before an Ikeja Magistrates’ Court for allegedly stealing pharmaceutical products worth N2.88 million and a Toyota Camry worth N1.8 million.
The prosecutor, Insp Funmi Akinleye, alleged that the defendant committed the offences between Jan. 4, 2021 and October 2021, at Opebi area of Lagos State.

headline: Spouses, children, siblings, parents that benefit from corruption must be punished — SENATE
summarized_story:
By Henry Umoru, ABUJACHAIRMAN, Senate Committee on Special Duties, Senator Yusuf Abubakar Yusuf, All Progressives Congress, APC, Taraba Central has called on the Federal Government to ensure that spouses, children, siblings, parents and all other beneficiaries of corruption proceeds must be punished along side the major actor in the crime.
Speaking with journalists in Abuja, Senator Yusuf called for the immediate creation of an agency that would be saddled with the responsibilities of confiscating proceeds of corruption.
“President Muhammadu Buhari has warned us that if we do not fight corruption, corruption would definitely not only fight us, but kill us a nation.
“His spouse, children, siblings and parents are all beneficiaries of corruption.
“So, while the law is criminalising an individual for corruption, and he is in jail, his wife, children, siblings and parents would all be enjoying the fruits of his corruption.

headline: Buhari demands return of more Nigeria’s artefacts abroad
summarized_story:
President Muhammadu Buhari has urged nations, institutions, private and public bodies, to return Nigeria’s artefacts in their possession.
Buhari made the call on Monday in reaction to Britain’s handover of Okukur and the Head of Oba of Benin bronzes, to the monarch, HRH Oba Ewuare II.
The artefacts were taken away by British soldiers in 1897 when they attacked the ancient Benin Kingdom.
”These are unprecedented moves worth emulating by others”, the President said while encouraging Britain to return others.
Buhari also commended Germany which is in the process of repatriating 1,130 Benin bronzes this year.

headline: Why Kano will host biggest rail station in Nigeria – Amaechi
summarized_story:
Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi, says Kano State will house the biggest rail station in the country because it will combine two rail lines.
Amaechi stated this when a delegation from Kano State, led by Gov.
”We are applying to the Kano State Government to give us land to build the biggest station in Nigeria.
”Don’t forget the station we are building in Kano will be the station that will take passengers from Lagos to Kano.
According to the minister, there will be an expansion in the concept of the Kano Station, which is largely the same framework as the Lagos Station but has more space than the Lagos Station.

headline: IPPIS: FG suspends salaries of 243 workers for shunning verification exercise
summarized_story:
The salaries of 243 workers have been suspended for failing to update their records online on the Integrated Payroll and Personnel Information System, IPPIS.
Recall that the Federal Government directed workers to update their records online on IPPIS platform and had promised to suspend the salaries of 1,173 of its workers by January if they fail to comply with the directives.
Ghost workers were also discovered in the office of the Auditor-General of the Federation, some federal government colleges and Office of the Accountant-General of the Federation.
The circular partly read, “Despite all the publicity and circulars to Ministries, Department and Agencies, some employees in the core MDAs did not comply with this directive and were suspected as ‘ghost’ workers.
“The salaries of 243 officers in the attached list have been suspended from the IPPIS platform immediately.

headline: Dapo Abiodun shuts down schools for installation of new Oba in Ogun
summarized_story:
Governor Dapo Abiodun of Ogun State has ordered that all schools in Ijebu-Igbo and its environ should be shut down on Wednesday over the installation of a new Orimolusi.
Recently, the Dapo Abiodun-ked government approved the nomination of Prince Lawrence Jaiyeoba Adebajo as the new Oba of the community.
As the Oba is to be crowned on Wednesday, Abiodun said all academic activities should be halted as a mark of honour for the new monarch.
This, he said, was also done to allow teachers, parents and students participate in the event.
“Therefore, as a mark of honour for the new monarch and to ensure a memorable event, the Governor of Ogun State, His Excellency, Prince Dapo Abiodun, MFR, has directed that all schools in Ijebu-Igbo and its environ should not open on Wednesday, 23rd February, 2022.

headline: Nigeria’s insecurity: Obasanjo recalls meeting with Boko Haram, laments 15m out-of-school children
summarized_story:
Former Nigeria’s President, Olusegun Obasanjo, has recalled his private meeting with the deadly Boko Haram in 2011.
The retired General warns that Nigeria must address the challenge of 15 million out-of-school children or face more problems in future.
His speech was on the theme “Beyond Boko Haram: Addressing Insurgency, Banditry and Kidnapping across Nigeria”.
Obasanjo, MMF Board of Trustees Chairman, noted that with Nigeria’s population of 215 million, 15 million out-of-school kids pose a serious problem.
“But if we don’t do anything about those 15 million out-of-school children, we are already in more trouble with Boko Haram of the future.

headline: NBS: Kerosene price declined by 6.60% in January
summarized_story:
The National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) has said the average retail price of household kerosene fell by 6.60 per cent last month.
NBS said the average price per gallon of kerosene paid by consumers decreased to N1528.74 last month from N1582.73 last December, indicating a decline in average retail price by 3.41 percent monthly.
- Advertisement -On a year-on-year, according to the Bureau, the average price per gallon of kerosene increased by 28.34 percent from N1191.13 in January 2021.
NBS said the zone with the lowest average retail price was the North-west with N243.62.
The NBS also said in another document entitled: “Liquefied Petroleum Gas (Cooking Gas) Price Watch (January 2022),” that the average price for refilling a 5kg cylinder of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (Cooking Gas) stood at N3657.57 in January 2022.

headline: Assembly issues ultimatum to Nasarawa over teachers’ salaries
summarized_story:
Nasarawa State House of Assembly has issued a two-week ultimatum to the state government to pay the three months salaries of 496 newly employed secondary school teachers.
Speaker of the Assembly, Ibrahim Balarabe Abdullahi, gave the directive when five senior government officials appeared before the House yesterday in Lafia, the state capital to clarify issues with the House regarding the teachers’ salaries.
“We are giving you from now and the end of the working hours of next week to pay the teachers their salaries,” he said.
Mr Nicholas Abari Aboki, the Head of Service confirmed the employment of 496 teachers.
He assured the lawmakers that he would write a memo to Governor Abdullahi Sule for approval on the payment of the teachers’ salaries.

headline: From $380bn Loss in 50 Years, Nigeria’s Oil Industry Begins In-country Annual Retention of $8bn
summarized_story:
•50,000 jobs created since creation of NOGICD Act, says Wabote•Local oil firms now produce 60% of Nigeria’s domestic gasEmmanuel Addeh in AbujaFrom a whopping $380 billion loss in capital flight due to the absence of an enabling law for retention of capital in the oil and gas industry, Nigeria currently has an annual in-country retention of $8 billion under the Nigerian Oil and Gas Industry Content Development (NOGICD) Act.
Executive Secretary of Nigerian Content Development and Monitoring Board (NCDMB), Mr. Simbi Wabote, stated this in Lagos during a meeting with editors.
Wabote revealed that about two million jobs were also lost during the 50 years that the country’s oil and industry operated without a capital retention law.
But he said at least 50,000 jobs had so far been created with the implementation of the NOGICD Act.
As part of this goal, the board, he noted, would catalyse the creation of 300, 000 direct jobs in the oil and gas industry and linkage sectors and enable the retention of $13 billion out of the estimated annual $20 billion spend in the oil and gas industry.

headline: BREAKING: Court Declines Disgraced 'Supercop', Abba Kyari's Bail Application As Lawyer Says He Is Diabetic, Hypertensive
summarized_story:
A Federal High Court in Abuja has refused to hear an application filed by the disgraced Deputy Commissioner of Police, Abba Kyari, seeking bail.
Kyari, accused of drug trafficking, has been in the custody of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA).
However, he filed an application asking the court to grant him bail on the grounds of ill health.
In an ex parte application brought before the court on Monday, Kyari through his counsel, Cynthia Obianuju, told the court that his health was suffering.
His counsel, Cynthia described his client as diabetic and hypertensive, thereby praying the court to grant him bail pending the determination of the substantive suit.

headline: Nine Ghanaians Arrested in Lagos For Allegedly Smuggling N200million Indian Hemp Into Nigeria
summarized_story:
The Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC), Lagos State Command, on Monday, paraded nine Ghanaians for allegedly smuggling about 201 bags of Indian hemp (cannabis sativa) valued at N200m into the country.
The suspects are Musa, Gasie, Adotete, Sottie, Tette, Okonipa, Stephen, Toyokpti and Natte all Ghanaians fishermen.
Parading the suspects at the Command’s headquarters in Ikeja, Lagos State, the state commandant, Edenabu Okoro Eweka, said the suspects were arrested through the support of the Nigerian Navy.
Narrating how the suspects were arrested, Eweka said: “The suspects loaded the products in a shop with the hope of smuggling them into the country.
“They were apprehended when they ran out of fuel and one of them strolled into the country to get fuel.

headline: 2023: 'He was misunderstood’ — aide clarifies Tinubu's ‘fight dirty’ comment
summarized_story:
Tunde Rahman, media aide to Bola Tinubu, a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC), says his principal’s comment on being “ready to get dirty” over his presidential bid was misunderstood.
I have read about a Greek philosopher that if you want to fight a pig, you must be ready to be smeared and I’m ready to be dirty,” Tinubu had said.

There is a wise saying that if you want to wrestle with the pig, be ready to get dirty and deal with the poo-poo.

headline: Report: Despite petrol subsidy, transport fares increased by 283% in five years
summarized_story:
SBM Intelligence, a geopolitical research firm, says despite petrol subsidy payments, transport costs and petrol prices increased disproportionally from 2017 to 2021.
SBM said this in a new report by the research firm titled ‘Growing Fuel Subsidy and Transport Costs: Which Way Forward, Nigeria?’It said over five years, petrol prices increased by 12.1%, petrol subsidy by 890% and transport cost by 283%.
And the answer wasn’t far-fetched in the huge amounts that went into fuel subsidy for the period,” SBM Intel said.
Advertisement“Around this time (April to June 2020), petrol price was reduced to N125, yet transport cost didn’t reduce.
Between 2020 and 2021, fuel subsidy cost increased by almost 20%, transport cost increased by a corresponding 33% while fuel price increased at a meagre 1.8%.”

headline: Crypto crime grows to $14 billion as crypto popularity increases
summarized_story:
In 2021, crypto criminals made a killing, as illicit crypto transactions hit $14 billion, a 79% jump from the $7.8 billion recorded in 2020, according to a report by US-based blockchain analytics company, Chainalysis.
The growth in illicit crypto transactions is attributed to a 567% jump in overall transaction volume in 2021.
Given that overall crypto transactions grew to $15.8 trillion in 2021, it is not surprising that cybercriminals are increasingly using crypto.
Despite the increase in the total volume of illicit transactions, illicit transactions represented just 0.15% of the total cryptocurrency transaction volume in 2021—its lowest ever.
What this means is that legitimate crypto transactions far outstrip illegal transactions.

This rebrand will help shift public perception of the MTN brand and also influence its market valuation.

headline: UNN to establish Research Centre on African Philosophy in honour of Prof Uzodinma Nwala
summarized_story:
OBINNA EZUGWUThe Department of Philosophy at the University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN), has concluded plans for the establishment of a Research Centre on African Philosophy, to mark the birthing of the study of African Philosophy as a field of study in the curriculum of the global University system.
The event is one of the activities lined up to celebrate the 80th birthday of Prof. Timothy Uzodinma Nwala who pioneered the teaching of African Philosophy in UNN and made it an internationally recognised discipline.
Nwala, an eminent Professor of Philosophy and the first Nigerian to take a degree in Philosophy from an indigenous Nigerian university, taught at UNN for 30 years before he left to go and teach/establish the Philosophy Department in other universities such as University of Abuja, Benue State University, Nasarawa State University and Kogi State University.
A former President of the Nigerian Philosophical Association (NPA), Prof. Nwala is generally regarded in the academia as the father of African Philosophy.
Nwala is currently the President of Alaigbo Development Foundation (ADF), a Frontline pan-Igbo organization.

The suit, marked FHC/ABJ/CS/177, challenged Atiku’s eligibility on the premise that he is not a Nigerian by birth.

headline: Breaking: Court throws out suit challenging Atiku’s citizenship
summarized_story:

Justice Inyang Eden Ekwo struck out the suit instituted by the Incorporated Trustees of Egalitarian Mission for Africa challenging the Nigerian citizenship of former number two man in Nigeria.

The suit which was filed on 11th February, 2019, has Atiku, PDP, the Independent National Electoral Commission, the Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice as well as the Attorney General of Adamawa state as defendants.

AdvertisementAccording to him, it is normal that periods leading to election year are always characterised by tension, but he remains optimistic that the period will come and go and the elections will be peaceful.

headline: Nigeria: Court Rejects Detained ‘Super Cop’ Abba Kyari’s Suit Demanding Freedom
summarized_story:
Justice Inyang Eden Ekwo of the Federal High Court in Abuja on Monday refused to order Nigeria’s Federal Government to release the detained Deputy Commissioner of Police, Abba Kyari from custody.
The suspended DCP had dragged the Federal Government before the court challenging his continued detention by an agency of government.
The anti-narcotics agency had on February 14, 2022, indicted Kyari, ex-head of the police Intelligence Response Team, in alleged drug trafficking and related offences.
The NDLEA said Kyari, the suspended IRT head, belonged to a drug cartel that operates the Brazil-Ethiopia-Nigeria illicit drug pipeline.
The IGP in a statement had corroborated the NDLEA’s findings, saying incontrovertible evidence indicted Kyari in the drug crimes.

headline: Detained ‘Super Cop’ Abba Kyari Sues Nigerian Government, Demands Release
summarized_story:
Suspended Deputy Commissioner of Police, Abba Kyari, has dragged the Nigerian Government to court to seek release from the custody of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency.
The anti-narcotics agency had on February 14, 2022, indicted Kyari, ex-head of the police Intelligence Response Team, in alleged drug trafficking and related offences.
The NDLEA said Kyari, the suspended IRT head, belonged to a drug cartel that operates the Brazil-Ethiopia-Nigeria illicit drug pipeline.
The IGP in a statement had corroborated the NDLEA’s findings, saying incontrovertible evidence indicted Kyari in the drug crimes.
The United States Attorney’s Office at the Central District of California declared Kyari wanted for the alleged offence.

headline: Tinubu Says He Is Ready To Get Dirty To Become Nigeria’s President – Trending With Ojy Okpe
summarized_story:
Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu, presidential aspirant on the platform of the All Progressives Congress has been trending on Twitter for saying he’s ready to get dirty in order to become President of Nigeria.
Campaign posters, and souvenirs of the Apc chieftain have been circulating on social media since he declared his intention to run for the 2023 presidential election.
The latest is a video of paper cups allegedly manufactured at a factory overseas.
Reactions are trailing Former President Olusegun Obasanjo’s comment which he made over the weekend suggesting that Nigeria needs more rebels who can speak uncomfortable truths.
Police Constable, Mary Yetunde Aina over the weekend clinched the World Boxing Foundation International Super Bantamweight title.

headline: Nigeria Air Strike Targeting Terrorists Kills Children in Niger Republic, Official Says
summarized_story:
The Nigerian military has killed and wounded children in an air attack in neighbouring Niger, according to a local governor in Niger, state television and an aid agency.
The attack took place in the village of Nachade in the region of Maradi, Niger, on Friday, a few kilometres from the border with Nigeria, said Chaibou Aboubacar, the governor of Maradi.
“There was a mistake with the Nigerian strikes on the border that resulted in victims on our territory in the village of Nachade,” said the official.
“The victims are 12 children, seven of them dead and five wounded.”According to the governor, “the parents were attending a ceremony and the children were probably playing when the strikes” hit them.
Four children died instantly and three others succumbed “to their injuries while being transported to hospital”, he said.
